Source:
स्याम! मने चाकर राखो जी,
गिरधारिलाल! चाकर राखो जी॥

चाकर रह सूँ बाग लगा सूँ, नित उठ दरसण पासूँ।
बिंद्राबन की कुंजगलिन में, तेरी लीला गासूँ॥

चाकरी में दरसण पाऊँ, सुमिरन पाऊँ खरची।
भाव भगति जागीरी पाऊँ, तीनूँ बाताँ सरसी॥

मोर मुगट पीतांबर सोहे, गल बैजंती माला।
बिंद्राबन में धेनु चरावे, मोहन मुरली वाला॥

हरे हरे नित बाग लगाऊँ, बिच बिच राखूँ क्यारी।
साँवरिया के दरसण पाऊँ, पहर कुसुम्मी सारी॥

जोगी आया जोग करण कूँ, तप करणे संन्यासी।
हरि भजन कूँ साधु आयो, बिंद्राबन के बासी॥

मीरा के प्रभु गहिर गंभीरा, सदा रहो जी धीरा।
आधी रात प्रभु दरसन दीन्हें, प्रेम नदी के तीरा॥
Reference:
Shyaam! Let me be your servant   - Meera
Shyaam! Let me be your servant,
Giridhaarilaal! Let me be your servant.
I will be your servant
I will plant a garden for you
I will wake up every day to admire your darshan
In the green alleys of Brindaban, I will sing about your leelas-
your childish plays.
While I serve you,
I will be rewarded with your blissful darshan,
To chant your name, will be my pay
To be your devoted Bhakt, 
 will be my Jaagir, my estate
All three of these are good.
Adorned by a crown of peacock feathers,
yellow attire and a Baijanti Mala around his neck.
He is so enchanting and plays a flute,
He who herds his cows in Brindaban,
Everyday, I will plant a garden for you,
And ornate it with flower beds at the center.
I will wear a saffron saree,
And admire your darshan.
Jogi came to do jyog.
Sanyaasi came to do his tapasya.
The monks of Brindaban came to do Bhajan.
Meera's Prabhu is solemn, be patient.
Prabhu will give his darshan,
At midnight besides the river bank.
ChatGPT 5.2:
Shyam! Keep me as Your servant,
Giridharilal! Keep me as Your servant.

As Your servant I will tend the garden; each day I’ll rise to seek Your sight.
In the groves and lanes of Vrindavan, I will sing of Your play.

In service I’ll gain Your दर्शन, I’ll gain remembrance as my sustenance.
I’ll receive the fief of loving devotion—better than all three.

The peacock crown and yellow robe suit You; on Your neck the Vaijayanti garland.
In Vrindavan You graze the cows—Mohana, the flute-player.

Green, green—each day I’ll plant the garden, and set beds in between.
I’ll behold Sanwariya; I’ll wear a saffron sari at every watch.

A yogi comes to practice yoga, an ascetic to perform austerities.
A sadhu comes to sing Hari’s name—dwelling in Vrindavan.

Mira’s Lord is deep and profound; ever remain steadfast.
At midnight the Lord granted दर्शन—on the bank of the river of love.

Source: पद्मा के चन्द्र-मुख पर षोड़श कला की शुभ्र चन्द्रिका अम्लान खिल रही है। एकान्त कुंज की कली-सी प्रणय के वासन्ती मलयस्पर्श से हिल उठती,विकास के लिए व्याकुल हो रही है।
Reference: (The radiant - white moonlight of the heavenly sixteen skills is merrily blooming on Padma's moon face. She swayed as a lovely bud in the solitary grove touched by the spring winds from the sacred Malay mountains, yearning for growth.)
ChatGPT 5.2: On Padma’s moonlike face, the stainless moonlight of the sixteen arts is blooming, unfading. Like a bud in a lonely bower, stirred by the springtime Malaya breeze of love, it trembles and grows restless to unfold.

Source: पद्मा की प्रतिभा की प्रशंसा सुनकर उसके पिता ऑनरेरी मैजिस्ट्रेट पण्डित रामेश्वरजी शुक्ल उसके उज्ज्वल भविष्य पर अनेक प्रकार की कल्पनाएँ किया करते हैं। योग्य वर के अभाव से उसका विवाह अब तक रोक रक्खा है।
Reference: When her father listens to the appreciations of her talents, Honorary magistrate Pandit Rameshwarji Shukla, imagines various prospects of her bright future. Due to the lack of eligible bachelors, her marriage has not yet been done.
ChatGPT 5.2: Hearing praise of Padma’s talent, her father, Honorary Magistrate Pandit Rameshwarji Shukla, would often indulge in all kinds of imaginings about her bright future. For lack of a suitable groom, her marriage has been held off until now.

                                      - Dhumil

That nakedness,
is a strict proceeding,
against being blind.

नगर के बीचो-बीच

आधी रात—अँधेरे की काली स्याह
शिलाओं से बनी हुई

भीतों और अहातों के, काँच-टुकड़े जमे हुए
ऊँचे-ऊँचे कंधों पर

चाँदनी की फैली हुई सँवलाई झालरें।
Reference:
Crooked-face moon

Amidst the city
The black ink of midnight’s darkness
On the high shoulders
of walls and courtyards-, 
made up of stones,
there are cemented glass -shards
scattering moonlight's dusky tassels.

In the very heart of the city

Midnight—darkness, black and pitch,
made of stone slabs,

on the walls and in the courtyards, shards of glass set fast
upon tall shoulders,

the spread-out, dusky fringes of moonlight.

ସନ୍ଧ୍ୟା ଓ ରାତ୍ରି
ଦେଖ, ସୂର୍ଯ୍ୟ ପଶ୍ଚିମ ଦିଗରେ ବୁଡ଼ିଯାଉଅଛି । ଏତେବେଳେ ତାହାର ତେଜ
କମିଯାଇଅଛି । ସେ କି ସୁନ୍ଦର ଲାଲ ଦିଶୁଅଛି । ସୂର୍ଯ୍ୟର ଅସ୍ତ ସମ ସମୟକୁ ସନ୍ଧ୍ୟା ବୋଲାଯାଏ |
ଦେଖୁ ଦେଖୁ ଅନ୍ଧାର ମାଡ଼ିଆସୁଅଛି । ଆକାଶରେ ଗୋଟି ଗୋଟି ହୋଇ କେତେ ଉଇଁ
ଆସୁଅଛନ୍ତି । ଏବେ ରାତ୍ରି ହେଲାଣି । ରାତିବେଳେ ମନୁଷ୍ୟ, ପଶୁ, ପକ୍ଷୀ ସମସ୍ତେ ନିଦରେ
ଶୁଅନ୍ତି । କେତେକ ରାତ୍ରିରେ ଚନ୍ଦ୍ର ସଞ୍ଜବେଳୁ ଆକାଶରେ ଦେଖାଯାଏ । ସେହିସବୁ ରାତ୍ରିକୁ
ଶୁକ୍ଳପକ୍ଷର ରାତ୍ରି ବୋଲାଯାଏ । କେତେକ ରାତ୍ରିରେ ଚନ୍ଦ୍ର ସନ୍ଧ୍ୟାବେଳେ ଦେଖାଯା ଖାଯାଏ ନାହିଁ ।
ସେହିସବୁ ରାତ୍ରିକୁ କୃଷ୍ଣପକ୍ଷର ରାତ୍ରି ବୋଲାଯାଏ । ଶୁକ୍ଳପକ୍ଷରେ ଚନ୍ଦ୍ର ଦିନକୁ ଦିନ ବଢ଼ିବାର
ଦେଖାଯାଏ । କୃଷ୍ଣପକ୍ଷ ରାତ୍ରିରେ ଚନ୍ଦ୍ର ଦିନକୁ ଦିନ ଛିଡ଼ିବାର ଦେଖାଯାଏ । ପୂର୍ଣ୍ଣିମା ରାତ୍ରିରେ ଚନ୍ଦ୍ର
ପୂରା ଗୋଲ ଦିଶେ । ଅମାବାସ୍ୟା ରାତ୍ରିରେ ଚନ୍ଦ୍ର ଏକାବେଳକେ ଅଦୃଶ୍ୟ ହୋଇଯାଏ ।

Reference:
2.	Evening and night
Look at the sun, it is setting in the west. The brightness of the sun has diminished by now. It looks so beautifully red. The time when the sun sets is known as evening. Gradually the darkness is scattering everywhere. One by one the stars have covered the sky. Now it's night. The humans, animals, birds and everyone else sleeps at night.
ChatGPT 5.2:
**Evening and Night**  
Look, the sun is setting in the west. By now its brightness has faded. How beautifully red it looks. The time of sunset is called evening.  

As you watch, darkness begins to spread. In the sky, stars are appearing one by one. Now it is night. At night, people, animals, and birds all sleep.  

On some nights, the moon can be seen in the sky from evening. Such nights are called the nights of the bright fortnight. On some nights, the moon is not seen in the evening. Such nights are called the nights of the dark fortnight.  

In the bright fortnight, the moon appears to grow day by day. In the dark fortnight, the moon appears to wane day by day. On the full-moon night, the moon looks perfectly round. On the new-moon night, the moon becomes completely invisible.
